title: Implement retry logic with exponential backoff

task.title: Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
task.description:
## Context
Add retry logic with exponential backoff for HTTP requests to handle transient failures gracefully.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** sonnet
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Create a retry decorator or utility function. Use exponential backoff with jitter.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create retry utility in `src/cub/core/toolsmith/http.py` or similar
2. Implement retry decorator with configurable attempts, backoff, jitter
3. Apply to all HTTP-fetching code in source adapters
4. Add timeout configuration
5. Log retry attempts

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Retry utility implements exponential backoff
- [ ] Default: 3 retries, 1s base delay, 2x multiplier
- [ ] Jitter added to prevent thundering herd
- [ ] Retries only on transient errors (5xx, timeout, connection error)
- [ ] No retry on 4xx errors (permanent failures)
- [ ] Retry attempts are logged
- [ ] Configurable via parameters
- [ ] mypy passes with strict mode

## Files Likely Involved
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/http.py` (new)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/sources/*.py` (modify to use retry)

## Notes
- Consider using `tenacity` library if available, else implement manually
- httpx has built-in timeout support - use it
- Add reasonable default timeout (30s)
- Consider circuit breaker pattern for future
